channel.title: Looking for Experts/Consultants IATI
channel.description:
Hi,
I am working for a Belgian Federation (Fiabel). As from 2018, our members are obligated to report in IATI. Most of them will be using Aidstream but some will be working directly from their own internal database. We are looking for experts/consultants who can assist our members to prepare their internal databases for IATI reporting (and ensure data can directly transformed to IATI standard). Any advice? (we are based in Brussels) Thanks, Ruth Beeckmans, Policy Advisor Fiabel

item.title: Looking for Experts/Consultants IATI
item.dc:creator: Maaike_Blom
item.description:
Dear Ruth,

We as Data4Develoment have supported a large number of Dutch NGOs with their IATI publications since the beginning of 2016 when the Dutch Ministry started to use the IATI standard. For this purpose we have developed a.o. a spreadsheet2IATI tool, that is relatively easy for organisations to use. We support this tool with tailor made advice and data quality feed back to improve the publications.

If you are interested, please get in touch at maaike@data4development.nl

Thanks,
Maaike

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for Experts/Consultants IATI
item.dc:creator: JohnAdams
item.description:
You’ll need someone to implement this who knows SQL databases well, but we have released our internal tool that generates IATI data from our internal databases.

GitHub

DFID/SQL-to-IATI-Database

The SQL to IATI Database repository contains all of the SQL scripts that are required to build DFID’s IATIv203 database, which is used by DFID to transform their internal data into IATI v2.03 stand...

Read full topic
